revised_title: Pleistocene Sea-Level Fluctuations and Subsidence in Southeast England
tldr: This article discusses the fluctuations of land and sea levels in southeastern England during the Pleistocene period. It examines the factors contributing to these changes, including eustatic sea-level changes and local subsidence or upwarping of the Earth's crust. The study also considers the challenges in determining the exact course of these changes and the absence of a stable reference point for assessing sea-level changes.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Geophysics
